solution_line_template: Bill gives each of his children {apples_per_child} apples, so since he has {num_children} children this is {apples_per_child}*{num_children}=<<{apples_per_child}*{num_children}={apples_given_to_kids}>>{apples_given_to_kids} apples.

Jill bakes {num_pies} apple pies, using {apples_per_pie} apples each so this means she uses {apples_per_pie}*{num_pies}=<<{num_pies}*{apples_per_pie}={apples_used_for_pies}>>{apples_used_for_pies} apples.
In total, this means {apples_used_for_pies}+{apples_given_to_kids}=<<{apples_used_for_pies}+{apples_given_to_kids}={total_apples_used}>>{total_apples_used} apples were used.

Since Bill began with {initial_apples} apples, this means there are {initial_apples}-{total_apples_used}=<<{initial_apples}-{total_apples_used}={apples_remaining}>>{apples_remaining} apples remaining.
